title.rendered: “IDF Fighter Jets Target Hezbollah Infrastructure in Southern Lebanon: An Inside Look at the Latest Aerial Interceptions and Responses”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Fighter jets attacked a terrorist infrastructure and a military building of the Hezbollah terrorist organization in southern Lebanon. A short while ago, air defense fighters and fighter jets intercepted two aircrafts over Lebanese territory.

A short time ago, fighter jets attacked a terrorist infrastructure and a military building of the Hezbollah terrorist organization in the area of Aita al-Shaab.
Earlier today, IDF forces carried out firing to remove threats in several areas in southern Lebanon.
Fighter jets and air defense fighters of the Air Force intercepted a short time ago two unmanned aircrafts over Lebanese territory.
Additionally, several rockets were detected crossing from Lebanon towards several areas in the north of the country. Hits were detected in the area of Shlomi, which caused a fire in the area. Firefighting forces are working on site to extinguish the fire. There were no casualties.
